Content.Content: Twitter] ;LinkedIn] Facebook] K Kegel, S Götz, R Marx, U AßmannNowadays, iterative development has become a state-of-the-art engineering process. The shared artifacts, ie, models, must be edited collaboratively to make iterative development work in large engineering teams. The typical non-real-time collaboration workflow consists of three phases: The collaborators create copies of the model; Each collaborator edits their variant (copy) of the model; The collaborators merge the edited models back into one.
